update changelog for release

* start improving scrgb handling for ppmsave

* seems to work

* fix test_formats.sh

* more HDR Path testing

a better HDR test image, plus tests of PFM, TIF and RAD hdr paths

* improve rad tests

* cleanup

* print test log on fail

* Update .github/workflows/ci.yml

* implement unaligned byteswap

* add padding to ppm save to align data

* oops, left a printf()

commit.message: Merge branch '8.15'

Check linker supports target_clones attribute (#3888)

This allows libvips to be built with buggy versions of LLVM where
the compiler but not linker supports this feature, and therefore
prevents an "undefined symbol: __cpu_model" error at link time.

verification.payload:
tree c7e0985f2d57fa780fa2792062021293e11e5b02
parent e31276312eb070265b435c4763f9924a51e0abdf
author Lovell Fuller <lovell@users.noreply.github.com> 1710087522 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710087522 +0000

Check linker supports target_clones attribute (#3888)

This allows libvips to be built with buggy versions of LLVM where
the compiler but not linker supports this feature, and therefore
prevents an "undefined symbol: __cpu_model" error at link time.

commit.message: Merge branch '8.15'

tiffsave: ensure large file support (>2GB) on MSVC (#3864)

On MSVC, `off_t` and `lseek()` are limited to signed 32-bit offsets,
which limits their capability to handle files larger than 2GB.

To support saving TIFF files that exceed this size, replace their use
with `gint64` and `vips__seek()`, where the latter uses `_lseeki64()`
internally.

See: https://github.com/conan-io/conan/issues/15578.

verification.payload:
tree ee1eb52235a1d6d90b83b10de7d112719c549f9a
parent 8dc96734875f9238055bdf6693461d47900d0d47
author Kleis Auke Wolthuizen <github@kleisauke.nl> 1708450287 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708450287 +0000

tiffsave: ensure large file support (>2GB) on MSVC (#3864)

On MSVC, `off_t` and `lseek()` are limited to signed 32-bit offsets,
which limits their capability to handle files larger than 2GB.

To support saving TIFF files that exceed this size, replace their use
with `gint64` and `vips__seek()`, where the latter uses `_lseeki64()`
internally.

See: https://github.com/conan-io/conan/issues/15578.

commit.message: improve linebreaks

Revert "WebP: add argument for using "auto-filter"/"smart_deblock" (#3852)"

This reverts commit 72f0fc440e7aa66a27d8ecab3aa50aeda85778e3.

WebP: add argument for using "auto-filter"/"smart_deblock" (#3852)

Adds the ability to configure whether or not the "auto-filter" feature from libwebp is used when encoding lossy WebPs.
This is put behind a new optional argument/toggle called/named "smart_deblock" in libvips.

verification.payload:
tree a64e8b4f9d026601c2991bfe00db5a96c0b95ecf
parent 52698b8db469e6915958ac3288b8a96fe6ebb717
author goodusername123 <61405538+goodusername123@users.noreply.github.com> 1708364999 -0600
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708364999 +0000

WebP: add argument for using "auto-filter"/"smart_deblock" (#3852)

Adds the ability to configure whether or not the "auto-filter" feature from libwebp is used when encoding lossy WebPs.
This is put behind a new optional argument/toggle called/named "smart_deblock" in libvips.

commit.message:
support long exif values (#3858)

* support long exif values

We were using static fixed length buffers to render i18n strings from
libexif. Fields like "copyright" and "artist" can have extremely long
values, and these were being truncated.

This PR adds g_auto as a hard requirement for libvips. This is supported
by all recent versions of clang and gcc, so hopefully it's OK.
openslide, for example, requires this.

See https://github.com/libvips/libvips/issues/3857

Thanks MarcosAndre

* ban crazy size values in exif strings

* remove use of g_auto

* Update libvips/iofuncs/type.c

Co-authored-by: Kleis Auke Wolthuizen <github@kleisauke.nl>

---------

Co-authored-by: Kleis Auke Wolthuizen <github@kleisauke.nl>
